description:
In an unknown time a small island named Greenlock is being threatened by a person named President Shrubb and his fascist captain, Olive North.

An island populated by artist and ran by children they are attacked by North's "Berserkers". One night the leader of Greenlock's child army, Saldin, destroies the only bridge leading to the "main city", stopping North's troops. The next day the leadership of Greenlock try to decide what to do and if blowing the bridge was the right idea until Shrubb contacts them, demanding they give up the island for his factories, saying they are a bunch of useless artist and writers. They cut off the screen and decide to protect their home.

In his corporate stronghold Shrubb yells at North, demanding to know why she failed to get the island. As he yells at her he is visited by a person named Danny Partridge and Bishop O'Shera from the Church of the Holy Gun. Shrubb doesn't want to hear what they have to say, espically when they bring up the name Dr. Lombata. But when they tell him that the doctor is making up a secret weapon that can take the island Shrubb is pleased.

Back on Greenlock the people prepare for the coming attack. In a bar some of the kids ask Chip, an older boy what he thinks about fighting. He says it is foolish to fight aginst a trained army, and that Shrubb controls the media so the country now thinks Greenlock is the enemy. When asked if he thinks Greenlock should give up he says no, they need the Avatar. The kids laugh at him, when a young boy named Wart (the boy telling this story) he is told the Avatar is "superstitious mumbo-jumbo"

Wart goes and ask Chip about the Avatar. Chip tells him the Avatar is a force, a protector that comes to Greenlock's aid. Before Wart can ask any more questions an alarm sounds. North and her men enter the island though power line tunnels. Chip tells Wart to go get help. Saladin and his troops rush at the enemy, but without armor they are beaten baddly. As Wart witnesses the horror of the battle he suddenly feels good, thats when the Avatar appairs.

The Avatar leaps into battle, cutting down the enemy forces with no problem. The children, getting their second wind seeing the Avatar, they rush the now frightened enemy back to the tunnel they came through. As she and her men retreated they cut the power lines and blow up the tunnel. The Avatar vanishes but the children know if they need him again he will return.

Across the river Shrubb is angry about the reports of a "Magic Warrior" and demands that he wants all the children dead. Danny talks to Dr. Lombata about Shrubb being angry but the doctor tells him not to worry, that soon they will have something better than a magic warrior, showing Danny what looks to be some kind of creature.

Go back to the beginning with Dark Horseâ€™s 1 for $1 comics! Get in on the ground floor of twelve featured titles from our popular comics pantheon. See what started it all in these first-issue classics from Dark Horse Comics. Drawing on the original Robert E. Howard stories, the legend of Conan is brought to vivid life for the modern audience. Decades ahead of its time, Howard's stories can finally get the graphic treatment they deserve in this on going series.
name: Out of the Darksome Hills

deck: Untitled; The Way of the Trolls (Part 1);
name: Untitled; The Way of the Trolls (Part 1);

deck: Untitled; The Way of the Trolls (Part 2);
name: Untitled; The Way of the Trolls (Part 2);

description: The I5 must contend with a mountain of garbage that engulfs the city. Dr. Gruesome (their first foe from Showcase) designs an atomic egg.

Another volume of offbeat and hysterical Plas adventures by Harvey and Eisner Award-winning cartoonist Kyle Baker! In RUBBER BANDITS, collecting PLASTIC MAN #8-11 and #13-14, our pliable hero wrecks continuity as we know it, investigates a vampire, gets in trouble with homeland security, battles a menacing mouse, and stops one of the worst crimes ever: illegal music downloading!
name: Plastic Man: Rubber Bandits

description: Popular Rei and shy Kira are worlds apart, until one fateful day brings them together. Rei stumbles upon Kira in the harassing hands of her sleazy art teacher and saves the quiet girl from his clutches. And when the jock plants a kiss on a statue of Mars in the studio, Kira finds herself drawn to him and even summons up the nerve to ask him to model for her. But problems already lurk on the horizon. Vicious upperclassman Harumi has had her sights set on Rei for a long time, and is not about to let go now.
name: Vol. 1

description: No one expected Kira and Rei's relationship to last. He's a street-wise biker with a dark past, she's a shy art student who's picked on by her peers. When another student steals Kira's painting and uses it to win an art show, Rei shows his love by resorting to fisticuffs. The meek Kira wonders if maybe they aren't made for each other after all.
name: Vol. 2

description: Kira is a lonesome waif who cares more about her art than anything else. Rei is an arrogant, rebellious and tough playboy who wears his delinquency like a badge. When these two opposites find each other, the sparks fly, but they also attract some unwanted attention. While Kira deals with Rei's jealous suitors, Rei has to confront demons from his past.
name: Vol. 3

description: When old friends of Rei show up at the school fair, Kira finds that she may have some heated competition for his love. His old flame, Shiori, confesses that she never gave up loving Rei, and she now wants him back. To make things worse, Kira uncovers more about Rei's dark past and his brother's suicide. Would she be better off if she just let Shiori have him?
name: Vol. 4

description: When Rei gets sick, Kira takes care of him at his apartment...and sleeps over. After their night together, Rei tells Kira the real reason his twin brother Sei killed himself - Rei revealed to Sei a secret he knew Sei would never be able to handle. Kira comforts Rei, but does he need more from a girlfriend? When Kira's best friend, Harumi, warns Kira if she doesn't start sleeping with Rei soon that he'll probably break up with her, Kira's worries deepen. Then Rei's ex-girlfriend complicates matters even more when she tells Rei she's still in love with him...and will do anything to win him back. And who's the new guy at school? Will Kira suddenly have two boys to juggle? With pressure all around, Kira is about to make the biggest decisions of her life!
name: Vol. 5

description: Kira and Rei are definitely in love...but no one said love was easy. When a new guy enrolls in their school, he instantly develops a big crush on both Rei and Kira. (Gulp!) To make matters worse, it turns out that this mysterious stranger is actually a face from Rei's violent past. Slowly, Kira begins to discover Rei's darker side, but she's not so sure she likes what she sees. As scandalous stories and shocking secrets are revealed, Kira hopes beyond hope that their love will be able to conquer all. An epic romance that spans 15 volumes, MARS is one of Japan's most popular teen girl comics ever.
name: Vol. 6

description: Kira and Rei are made for each other...but no one said love was easy. In Volume 6, we met Masao - the new guy at school with a criminal past. In Volume 7, he directs his violent temper towards Kira. When Kira's mother is unexpectedly hospitalized, Rei and Harumi offer their undying support. Masao, who hates seeing Rei's sensitive side, is outraged, and he attempts to put Kira out of the picture...forever! As murderous plots are hatched and hidden secrets revealed, Kira and Rei must fight for each other...and for their lives.
name: Vol. 7

description: Every time Rei tries to make a move on Kira, she freaks and pushes him away. Finally, Rei guesses she's hiding a horrible secret from her past. Meanwhile, Kira's mother gets out of the hospital - and tells Kira they're moving. When Rei finds out, he tells Kira to come live with him, but she doesn't want to leave her mom. Could this be the end of Rei's and Kira's love?
name: Vol. 8

description: The unthinkable has happened! Rei and Kira have finally broken up and it's the talk of the town. Kira can only stand by helplessly as Rei walks out of her life. Though Rei feigns indifference and walks into the arms of waiting suitors, he begins to realize that he may have been too hasty in his decision to break up. Kira struggles to come to grips with being alone and also questions what she has done. At her friends' advice, she decides to try and make up with Rei before it's too late, but he is nowhere to be found. With her family life also suffering, Kira has no idea who to turn to. Find out what happens next in this nail-biting volume of Mars.
name: Vol. 9

description: Now that Rei and Kira are an 'official' couple, Kira experiences a refreshing taste of freedom for the first time in her life. She is finally able to leave her troubled past behind and give in to a newfound joy. As the happy couple takes a deep look at what they have together, they find themselves at one of life's major crossroads. The two must decide how school and work will play into their future. Kira decides to take a job in order to secure her independence, while Rei contemplates quitting school in order to support Kira and become a respectable member of society. Just when you think you have your future all mapped out, love enters the picture and changes the scenery.
name: Vol. 10

description: Nearly tragic domestic disturbances highlight this compelling volume of Mars. Step-fathers and fathers figure prominently and futures hang in the balance...as if Kira and Rei needed any more complications!
name: Vol. 11

description: Kira leaves home with her mother's blessing. In the process of her getting situated in new surroundings, she and Rei learn some complex and painful things about each other's families and pasts. Meanwhile, Rei remembers things about his mother's illness that shock him...
name: Vol. 12

description: Rei remembers more events from his childhood, and eventually learns some of the traumatic details surrounding his mother's death. The complicated relationships within his family are all brought out into the open. And, in a chilling aside, Masao dupes his doctors into thinking that he is capable of showing emotion. Will he be released?
name: Vol. 13

description: Rei struggles mightily to adapt to his newfound awareness about his family secrets. Kira must deal with the nerve-jangling anxieties of watching Rei perform on the racetrack. And, as if life needed any more twists and turns, Masao has indeed been released and is back on the streets...
name: Vol. 14

description: Rei and Kira decide to get married right away after all. But, at the last moment, Masao draws Rei into an alley by crying and saying he really needs to talk, then stabs him repeatedly, leaving him lying on the ground. During Rei's recovery, he and his father have a heart-to-heart for the first time. His family issues resolved, Rei does phenomenally well in his first race, and asks Kira to stand by him for the long run. She wouldn't have it any other way...
name: Vol. 15

description: MARS creator Fuyumi Soryo spins stories of the young and disenfranchised trying to make sense of their world: In a prequel to MARS, Tatsuya's intense jealousy of class bad-boy Rei turns into an unexpected friendship. Isamu is a troubled teen haunted by a tragic past he cannot change...
name: Vol. 1

description: Three different stories about three different men named Martin and three different men named John...Confused? So are they...about love, relationships and especially their feelings. This collection of stories take place in different places, in different times--all about a man named Martin and a man named John, and the struggle for love between them. Three Martins, three Johns, three emotionally charged stories of family, romance and, well...Martin and John.
name: Vol. 1

description:
If he doesn't start bringing in some money soon, Omario's going to have to start flipping burgers at the local MBQ to pay his rent. And as if fighting to stay afloat as an angry comic book artist isn't enough, Omario has to face down with a rookie cop who is struggling with his own anger management problems. Sometimes people are just looking for other people to blame. Omario blames the people that buy comic book crap; and the cop, well, he might just blame Omario.Â 

Chapter TitlesÂ 

  • Chapter 1:Â Never Sleep
  • Chapter 2:Â Karaoke Night
  • Chapter 3:Â Dee
  • Chapter 4:Â Thank You, Jeff
  • Chapter 5:Â Cops
  • Chapter 6:Â Customer Service
  • Chapter 7:Â Run
  • Chapter 8:Â I Draw Comics
  • Chapter 9: Off to Kinko's
name: Vol. 1

description: Big Bro Brody is the biggest, meanest, ugliest fighter in the business -- and he ain't none too happy about his little brother Richie getting a beatdown by Dee, who is trying to move a shipment of hot electronics. Across town, Omario has finished his comic submission and presents it with brim and bluster to Jeff, who is too nice to say what he really thinks about the work. He is also too nice to remind Omario about the rent.
name: Vol. 2

description: Round three: the knuckle-busting conclusion to writer/artist Felipe Smith's tale of talent finding recognition in Los Angeles! Omario still doesn't have a comic book contract or money -- or a roommate or food to eat, if he keeps acting the fool. Rookie Cop O'Malley struggles to manage fear and anger as he dives headfirst into Ktown's underworld. Over on the West Side, Brian and Jeff still hold down their daily grind. Will they be stuck there forever? Read and find out!
name: Vol. 3

description: One Lost Girl plus Four Confused Brothers equals A Whole Lotta Wackiness! When Sakura, a fourteen-year-old orphaned girl, discovers she has four half-brothers, her world is turned upside down as they're all forced to live under one roof... From international manga-ka Hari Tokeino comes a manga series that shows you can't choose your family--even though sometimes you might want to!
name: Vol. 1

description: Sakura has been living with her brothers for almost a year now, and they have surprisingly been getting along. With misunderstandings, love confessions, and rumors spreading, however, life for this family is never boring!
name: Vol. 2

description: When the Miyashita Family goes to a local summer festival, Sakura falls into the twilight zone and encounters Masashi...as a 14-year-old! When Sakura finally returns to the present, will she be able to make peace with him?
name: Vol. 3

description: Sakura and her brothers go to a cafÃ©, where they are treated to much more than just coffee! When the cafÃ©'s owner, Taizo Fukasawa, sees Sakura, he tells her that she looks exactly like his deceased girlfriend. He then invites her to a party--as his date! The brothers freak out, but Sakura accepts the invitation, leading her down a path no one could predict, a path that might even lead to her long lost father...
name: Vol. 4

description: Sakura's brothers are in an overprotective uproar when she accepts a manager position at a soccer camp and plans a group visit to a theme park. They know she'll be alone with boys, and they don't want anything to happen to their precious Sakura! So they devise a brilliant plan to "sneak and peak" on her field trip, but if they're this nervous about her being left alone with members of the opposite sex, imagine how scared they'll be when she catches them at their brotherly meddling!
name: Vol. 5

description: When Tsuyoshi returns home all beat up, Masashi and Sakura can't help but wonder what happened--it's a good distraction to help them stop to think about what happened on Valentine's Day! But as the two play detective, they follow Tsuyoshi to the hospital, where they make a startling discovery that just may make their household even more crowded!
name: Vol. 6

description: Midterms are coming up, and Sakura's been so busy worrying about telling Masashi how she feels that she hasn't had any time to study! So Naka-chan decides that Sonomura will join them at Sakura's house for a cram session. The first step is to get all the love concerns out of the way, but while they're talking, Masashi overhears Naka-chan telling Sonomura that Sakura likes Masashi. With all these distractions, will Sakura ever pass?
name: Vol. 7

description: Masashi's foster mother comes to visit with surprising news: she's arranged a formal marriage interview for Masashi! When it looks like he'll be forced to go along with it, what will Sakura do? Will she ever discover if Masashi has feelings for her? It'll take the soccer team, fireworks, and a kidnapping to find out!
name: Vol. 8

description: Tsuyoshi is wondering what on earth Sakura sees in Masashi when he runs into an old woman who mistakes him for her late husband. Will Tsuyoshi play along and what will he learn from her? Meanwhile, Masashi finds himself the object of unwanted affection when he meets a man named Matsubara who decides that "she" would make the perfect bride for him. Oh, and did we mention that all this is going on in the midst of Tsuyoshi and Masashi's intense rivalry! Throw a mysterious girl into the mix and youâ€™ve got the perfect recipe for fun!
name: Vol. 9

description: The peace at the Miyashita home is interrupted when a small child named Makoto, who looks extraordinarily like Masashi, shows up in search of her father. Masashi swears he's not the father, but he thinks he knows who is! Meanwhile, it's time for the grand opening of Tsuyoshi's cafe! Will rumors of a ghost keep customers away? And what will Sakura do when she discovers Nana telling another girl that he's dating Sakura!?
name: Vol. 10

description: The anticipated high school athletic meet has begun, and the battle between Kozuka and Masashi is on, each giving it their all to win a date with Sakura. Jealous girls, a hilarious race and a sweet moment of victory for...the winner may surprise you! In other events, unexpected occurrences befall Masashi causing confusion to Sakura. Painful feelings are at an all-time high as Sakura proclaims she is only a sister to the man she loves. Will Sakura give up her love for Masashi? Find out in the emotional finale of Me & My Brothers!
name: Vol. 11

description: From the gifted international artist Sho Murase comes a manga series that will force you to question anything and everything you think you know about reality...Aki is a shy, introverted teen trying to cope with the death of her older brother. This, coupled with the daily pressures being the most bullied kid in school, lead to her having mysterious blackouts. Entire days begin to be unaccounted for as Aki finds strange items in her closet. Adding to her bewilderment is that the cutest boy in school suddenly takes an interest in her. As Aki wonders if her grip on reality is slowly slipping away, something even more shocking might be behind this haunting tale...
name: Vol. 1

description: High school is difficult enough, especially when you live in the shadow of your stunningly attractive older brother...Kotori is often teased for being superficial, and with a gorgeous brother like Kujaku, you can't really blame him for thinking that looks are everything. However, once Akaiwa steps into the picture, Kotori's life is heading for a lesson in deep trust, self-confidence, and abiding love...Suzuki Tanaka has created a funny, life-affirming story about complexities of young love on a long and winding road that leads to the heart.
name: Vol. 1

description: Lovers Kotori and Akaiwa continuing to keep their relationship a secret from everyone, but the one person in whom they confide, Chikage, is running out of patience. Before they can figure out what's put their friend in such a bad move, Kotori finds himself captured by a beautiful ancient ghost in one of the school's bathroom mirrors. And on top of that, a special houseguest drops by to pay Kotori a visit when he gets sick!
name: Vol. 2

description: Kotori and Akaiwa may be getting along fine so far but what will happen when a girl from the past shows up to get in the way? Will the couple's bond remain strong, or will Akaiwa's out of control fits of jealousy become too much for poor Kotori? And what crazy adventures await when Kotori finds himself in a bizarre parallel world where all of his friends are acting out of character? Check out the final volume of Menkui to see how everything wraps up for our two young lovers!
name: Vol. 3

description:
You know what they say: If the century fits, then...travel back in time to become a pop-singing sensation!...Vivacious Neo loves to sing and tests the boundaries of 23rd-century modesty with her short, short skirts. When she accidently time-travels to the 21st century, it's time to sink or sing! Before she knows it, she's teamed up with the handsome Saya as half of the ultimate singing duo. But all her dreams may vanish if they can't put on one great concert. With Saya depending on her, will Neo keep time on her side?

Chapter Titles

  • â˜† Stage 1 â˜† Future Superstars â˜…
  • â˜† Stage 2 â˜† Applause is Nice â™«
  • â˜† Stage 3 â˜† No Place Like Home
  • â˜† Stage 4 â˜† Street Debut!
  • â˜† Stage 5 â˜† The Trials of A Pop Star...?
  • â˜† Bonus â˜† A Day In the Life "Clap = â˜…"
  • â˜† Bonus â˜† Treks and Tablewares â™¥
name: Vol. 1

description:
The bond between Neo and Saya strengthen as they prepare for the highly anticipated concert. Will â€œClap=[star icon]â€ end in bittersweet goodbyes or will they have a star debut as promised? And who really is Nanato, and why is he so protective of Neo? Meanwhile, the 23rd century finally makes contact with Neo but...

Chapter Titles

  • â˜† Stage 6 â˜† The Battle Draws Near
  • â˜† Stage 7 â˜† A Friend in Me
  • â˜† Stage 8 â˜† Upward and Onward
  • â˜† Stage 9 â˜† Dueling Centuries
  • â˜† Last Stage â˜† Neo's Decision â˜…
  • â˜† Extra Episode â˜† Foolproof Swim Lesson
name: Vol. 2

description:
When friends and loved ones begin to disappear, his sense of reality begins to crumble--until the day he runs into a mysterious figure who can erase a person's very existence... Gorgeously illustrated and spectacularly twisted, Kazumi-sensei's dramatic shojo is an unforgettable journey of discovery in a world filled with suspicion and awe.

Scene 1 - 4.
name: Vol. 1
